Title:
Bryoclavula phycophila gen. et sp. nov., a novel lichenized
lineage belonging to Hydnaceae (Cantharellales, Basidiomycota)
Keywords:
Culture, Lichenized fungi, Molecular phylogeny, New taxa,
Taxonomy, TEM
Abstract:
A new clavarioid and lichenized basidiomycete, Bryoclavula
phycophila gen. et sp. nov., is described from Japan based on
morphological observations and molecular phylogenetic analyses. Although
the fruiting bodies were dispersed on the bryophytes growing on a moist
rock, the hyphae were not associated with the bryophytes cells. Instead,
we confirmed that the hyphae loosely surrounded the spherical algal
cells on unidentified senescent bryophytes to form an undifferentiated
thallus. The observations by transmission electron microscopy revealed
that the algae had a pyrenoid. Morphological characters of B. phycophila
were similar to known lichenized fungi in the genus Multiclvula, but
were different from those in that it did not form a globular or
bulbil-like thallus but form an undifferentiated thallus. Molecular
sequence data of the large subunit of the nuclear ribosomal DNA gene
showed that the species was placed in the family Hydnaceae, but was
located in the independent lineage different from the genus
Multiclavula. A brief information of its isolate was also provided.
